newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks open firmer then retrace.
newsitem.headline: French stocks open firmer then retrace.

text.p: French stocks opened higher on Wednesday but reversed their gains in mid-morning trading as the bourse digested the previous day's 0.88 percent rise.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index was down 11.69 points or 0.55 percent at 2,130.15 at 1000 GMT, while the CAC-40 futures contract was 12.50 points lower at 2,136.50.

Shares in food group Bongrain fell 10.87 percent to 2,150 francs after the company reported a drop in first-half profit to 129.5 million francs from 164.6 million. Trade in the share was briefly suspended limit-down.
Electrical engineering group Schneider's stock fell 3.21 percent to 237.40 francs despite a 27 percent rise in the company's first-half profit to 503 million francs.
"People had got their hopes up before the results. The 503 million was really the bottom of the (forecast) range," a trader said.
